language.name: English International
language.group:
Clear Pronunciation Clear Pronunciation We hope you liked using Clear Pronunciation 1 - Sounds. http://www.clarityenglish.com/Content/ClearPronunciation-International/sharedMedia/phonemicChart.pdf http://www.clarityenglish.com/Content/ClearPronunciation10-International/help/ClearPronunciationSoundsHelp.pdf http://www.clarityenglish.com/Content/ClearPronunciation10-International/help/ClearPronunciationSoundsHelp.pdf Sorry Choose the section you want to view. Click on an activity below to start.

When you have finished this exercise, you will know important vocabulary to help you improve your pronunciation.

When you have finished this exercise, you will know the names of the parts of the mouth.

When you have finished this exercise, you will know why it is important to learn the International Phonemic Alphabet.

When you have finished this exercise, you should be able to:

- Recognise each sound when you hear it

- Pronounce the sounds in different positions in words, for example at the beginning, in the middle or at the end

- Recognise each phonemic symbol and know which sound it represents.

When you have finished this exercise, you should be able to hear and pronounce each of the sounds, in words and sentences.

Extra task: if the sound is at the beginning or end of the word, does it link to the word before or after?

When you have finished this exercise, you should be confident that you can recognise each of the sounds when you hear them.

When you have finished this exercise, you should be confident that you can recognise each of the sounds in a real-life situation.

When you have finished this exercise, you should be confident that you can read the phonemic symbols you will see in a dictionary.

Choose the channel that plays the video best in your current location. Practise the sounds How do I make the sounds? Please see Introduction and Consonants, Unit 13 to see the material in this demo. p f b m t d ʃ tʃ j dʒ g k w v θ s ð d s z ʒ h n ŋ r l ɪ i: e æ ə ʌ ʊ æ ɑː ʌ u: u: ɜː ɒ ɔː eə ɪə eɪ aɪ ɔɪ aɪ əʊ aʊ Click on the IPA symbol to play the animation. voiced sound: use your vocal cords unvoiced sound: don't use your vocal cords Sorry this animation will not run on tablet app, please use a computer to run the program. At first your teeth are slightly apart, with the front of your tongue down, and your lips together. Your lips are stopping the air coming out. When you open your lips, you release the air. /p/ is unvoiced, so you don;t use your vocal cords. Your bottom lip moves upwards to touch your top teeth. The soft part at the back of the roof of your mouth rises. As you make the sound, the air comes out of your mouth and the middle of your tongue moves down. /f/ is unvoiced, so you don't use your vocal cords.>
